isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - SPEEDOMETER/TACHOMETER DIAGNOSTICS AND SERVICE - REMOVE AND INSTALL - 9600, 9700 MODELS

svcsubproc.title: January 1989 to January 1991 - Speedometer/Tachometer Gauges, Remove

important.para: Turn switch key to OFF position before removing or installing unit.

note.para:
Before replacing speedometer or tachometer gauges, refer to CLUSTER FAILURE DIAGNOSIS
to verify gauge(s) need replacing.

step1.para: Remove four screws securing speedometer/tachometer panel to instrument panel. Tilt top of unit toward steering wheel ( Figure 14).

figure.caption: 9600, 9700 Models Speedometer/Tachometer Panel, January 1989 to January 1991

step1.para: Disconnect speedometer/tachometer connector from harness connector for each gauge. Also disconnect the two-speed axle connector from the speedo if so equipped ( Figure 9).
Pull the two gauge illumination light sockets out of the back of each gauge housing. Also pull the high beam indicator light socket out of the speedometer housing ( Figure 9).
Remove two special locking wing nuts from each gauge and the mounting U-bracket ( Figure 9).
Remove speedometer/tachometer gauges from instrument panel.

svcsubproc.title: January 1989 to January 1991 - Speedometer/Tachometer Gauges, Install

step1.para: Insert speedo/tach harness connectors through the gauge panel openings and connect to each gauge. (Reconnect the two-speed axle harness if so equipped.)
Insert the two gauge illumination bulb sockets into each gauge housing.

note.para: Insert the high beam indicator light #53 into the center speedo gauge opening.

step1.para: Align tab on speedometer and tachometer housings with slot in panel opening and position into the panel.
Install speedometer and tachometer mounting clamps with the special locking wing nuts.
Position the gauge cluster mounting panel into the vehicle instrument panel and install four mounting screws.

note.para: Test high beam indicator and illumination lights for operation prior to installing the mounting screws.

step1.para: Test lights and test speedometer and tachometer gauges on road or dynamometer after installation.

svcsubproc.title: January 1991 and Later - Speedometer/Tachometer Cluster, Remove

important.para: Turn switch key to OFF position before removing or installing unit.

note.para:
Before replacing a January 1991 to January 1994 speedometer/tachometer gauge cluster, refer to CLUSTER FAILURE DIAGNOSIS
to verify cluster needs replacing.

Before replacing a post January 1994 speedometer/tachometer gauge cluster, refer to CLUSTER FAILURE DIAGNOSIS
to verify cluster needs replacing.

step1.para: Remove screws securing speedometer/tachometer cluster to instrument panel. Tilt top of unit toward steering wheel ( Figure 10).
Disconnect speedometer/tachometer cluster from vehicle instrument panel harness and pull the four illumination lights and one high beam indicator light out of the back of the housing ( Figure 11).
Remove speedometer/tachometer cluster from instrument panel.

svcsubproc.title: January 1991 and Later - Speedometer/Tachometer Cluster, Install

step1.para: Position speedometer/tachometer cluster behind steering wheel, but tilted forward ( Figure 10).
Install four gauge illuminating lights and one high beam indicator light into back of housing ( Figure 11).
Connect speedo/tach cluster harness connectors to the vehicle harness connectors ( Figure 11).

note.para: Test high-beam and cluster illumination light operation before installing mounting screws mentioned in next step.

step1.para: Position unit into instrument panel and install mounting screws. Test speedometer/tachometer unit functions and lights on road test or on dynamometer when installation is complete.

svcsubproc.title: January 1991 and Later - Speedometer/Tachometer Gauges, Remove
svcsubproc.para: The speedometer/tachometer unit consists of four serviceable (replaceable) components: speedometer, tachometer, odometer and unit housing which includes the printed circuit board. To disassemble the unit to access the components:

step1.para: Remove six screws ( Figure 12), two on top and bottom and one on each end.
Lift off face plate to access three meters.
The speedometer and tachometer each mount on four pins. To remove either gauge, grip the edges of the gauge face plate and lift directly away from the housing.
To remove the odometer, first remove the speedometer gauge. Disconnect the odometer from the printed circuit at connector J1. Remove two screws from back of cluster that retain the odometer and clip.

svcsubproc.title: January 1991 and Later - Speedometer/Tachometer Gauges, Install

step1.para: To install the odometer, position it in the housing and install and tighten the two mounting screws. Connect the odometer lead to the J1 pins.

The speedo/tach gauges are plug-in type gauges. To install, grasp the gauge by the edge of the dial face. Align the four gauge pins to the circuit board terminal openings and gently push into place. The gauge case is non-conductive material so that if power were applied, the case will not short out the pins.
Position housing face plate and insert the six screws and tighten.
